description: Hygrophorus-like Milk Cap has orange to tan cap (4-10 cm), smooth, dry. Gills WIDELY SPACED (like Hygrophorus) - key feature. Stem similar color. KEY: WHITE LATEX, WIDELY SPACED GILLS. Resembles waxy caps but has latex. Flesh white. Spore print white.
habitat: Mycorrhizal with HARDWOODS, especially oak. Grows on ground in hardwood forests. Southern and eastern US. Scattered.
lookalikes: Hygrophorus species - NO LATEX, waxy gills
safety_notes: EDIBLE: Mild flavor. WIDELY SPACED GILLS + WHITE LATEX diagnostic. Cook thoroughly.
